Reviews.Title: “An amazing place! Most proffessional staff you'll find in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: AleXfendeR
Reviews.Content: Ok, this place is special! The location great, staff is amazing, very professional The place is run by a great, proud true- Roman bloodded manager, and this guy is not only the best noted manager I have ever met, but also the best guide to Rome Seriously - his guidance of Rome was worth the whole trip... I really recommend this place! 'Don't be fooled by it's commen place appearance... Like so many things, its a diamond in the rough!'...

Reviews.Title: “great city break”
Reviews.Author: daniel d
Reviews.Content: just back from 3 nights at the auditorium di mecenate fabulous little hotel in the perfect position to tour the city, close to all major attractions and the main bus/train terminal, the guy running the reception was a great help in fact fantastic gave us a map of the city and recommended various restraunts we ate at 3 of them and they were all great food and excellent value for money clean rooms and continental breakfast included in short a fabulous stay in the great city

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: PattyMaltez
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler I had the smallest room with a single bed, it is located adjacent to the front desk area, the room is the size of a walking closet with very dim lights (quite depressing) for someone who is away from home. THe hotel (I think is more like a penzione) is located in the third floor of an old building, there is no sign on the outside. The only possitive about this place are the super friendly staff, they truly made me feel better about staying there and helped me with tips and directions to the area. They were the friendliest italians I met. The only downside is that because my room was located at the entrance and the staff will occasionally go out to the foyer to smoke, I would get smoke in my room which was not very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: sunflowerBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auditorium di Mecenate for three nights from 8th March. The B&B is like nothing we have stayed in before and was a wonderful experience. It is in a good location with easy access to the metro (for Vatican City & St Peters) and the Colloseum and Roman Forum are within easy walking distance. The accommodation is small and basic, but very clean and tidy. The breakfast brought to your room is a nice idea (particularly if like me you struggle to get out of bed in the morning). However, the thing that makes this place so special is the staff. I am usually a control freak when it comes to planning, but after reading the reviews I decided to see what information would be provided by the staff. They were fantastic, giving detailed explanations of what to see, the best time to visit attractions and how to get there etc etc etc. Nothing was too much trouble and it almost felt like you were part of a big family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Janne L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Auditorium with my wife for four days and it was the perfect choice. Staff was wonderful and very helpful. Of course the hotel is basic but our room was big and clean. Close to Colosseum (only 10 min walk).

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay. would highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic36
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in August 2011.The hotel kept in contact with us by email to see if we wanted double/single bed.also they sent us directions for each airport to get to the hotel and they ended up hiring a cab for us for a few €'s more!!!very close to everything and the staff were very helpfull.We are planning to go back again this year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rosiedecember
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome having stayed in Auditorium di Mecenate (chosen from the great reviews on here). We weren't disappointed. The hotel is great - clean and basic - pretty much what you need from a hotel in Rome, and the location is perfect. We had no trouble finding the hotel, just make sure you know the address beforehand and there is a buzzer by the front door in case the porter isn't there. The staff are fantastic - all very friendly and welcoming. They are so helpful and recommended some fabulous restaurants (particularly Taverna Romana and Pizzeria "La Montecarlo") which were bustling full of locals and serving great food at competitive prices. We would definitely return to this hotel next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: marklar23
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was perfect for us. We were nice and close to the Collesium and only 2 minutes from the underground. The staff were very very helpful, always on call for advice. They recomended the best and most authentic restaurants in town. Just trust them on the food, especially no.8 on thier list! amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Moderate clean weird lodging in poor tourist location”
Reviews.Author: travelinman_CA
Reviews.Content: This is a tough one. A like, hate relationship. I would never stay here again, although the Auditorium di Mecenate is an interesting choice for some. Although I got some strange responses when I asked about the history of the building I stumbled upon the reason the named the hostel or inn the Auditorium di Mecenate about a half block away. It was a public meeting place with internal fountains that must have been amazing in its era. The only thing amazing about this B/B are the paintings on the ceilings of the rooms. Check them out, but I do not know about staying unless this is the best rate in town. I will pay more and get more next time. My rate was about $110 which was too high for this type of stay. Really did not like the location. It changed my visit to Roma this time. Did not like the lack of a lobby. You ring the bell in a building and they open the door with a buzzer. Like visitng a friend in a walk-up. You then take the little elevator to the floor that sort of looks like it could be your B/B; three trys for me. Once there, it is fine and convenient. Restaurants in neighborhood are poor. It is bad when you have raw pizza with tomato sauce in Italy. Even hotel recommended elsewhere. Good stuff: Nice little breakfast delivered to room. Great friendly staff. Clean spartan room that felt like a convent, in a good way.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was spot on. An authentic, clean, well located, quirky hotel with exceptional staff who are so friendly it makes it a”
Reviews.Author: Annarachelharrison
Reviews.Content: Had such a fab time and great experience at this hotel and although it was only a two star, it felt like a 5 star due to the staff being so friendly and tentative. It was reasonable and felt very italian giving us the best experience for a low budget. We'd stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the sights of ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: ReviewersJN
Reviews.Content: Great location – within walking distance of the Colosseum, Palatine Hill, the Forum. It’s also near to a Metro stop that gives access to sights further away. There are some very good Trattoria in close proximity and several places to get coffee and cake or ice cream after a hard day’s sightseeing. Great guest house - Lovely helpful staff on reception, which is open 24 hours. Breakfast brought to your room at any time between 7.30 and 10.30 (Coffee, juice and fresh pastries). They even brought ours a bit earlier on the last day when we needed to get to the airport. The guest house is located on the third floor of a historic building with courtyard. We loved the antiquated lift. The only minor niggle was the size of the room but the bed was huge and very comfortable and there is plenty of storage for clothes etc. Besides, you don't visit Rome to stay in your hotel room. We would probably stay here again if we went back to Rome. Booking note – This guest house has its own website (auditoriumdimecanate.com) with online booking facility but at the time of writing it doesn't seem to feature in the information bar on Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect couple's getaway”
Reviews.Author: londonfast
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is tucked away but in a fantastic location right next to a metro stop and within walking distance of all the main attractions. We stayed for four nights and the staff couldn't have been more helpful with food recommendations (spot on every time) to helping us find the best way to get around the city and how to make the most of our time. The rooms are small and simple but spotlessly clean and serviced every day - they have everything you need. Breakfast in bed is wonderfully indulgent - would definitely stay here again if I came back to Rome - the staff really make the place.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the triple room between 13th and 17th of February 2012. A pretty faultless stay enhanced by the helpfulness and service given by the host and the rest of the staff. Nothing was too much trouble. What lovely people! Although the rooms could be said to be plain, they are well appointed, very clean, along with the good en-suite, and would put a lot of 3 star accommodations to shame, especially considering the reasonable price. The breakfasts were more than ample with tea, coffee and other drinks always available whatever time of day. Security was good and the hotel is situated close to all transport links and some of the major attractions of Rome. All in all a pleasant break was made into a very enjoyable stay. If you are new to Rome, the host's knowledge of the city is invaluable. Diolch yn fawr. Ardderchog! John Davies (Pontypridd, WALES)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Daniel P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with the Auditorium di Mecenate for a week during the first leg of our Euro Trip in May of 2011. The staff is absolutely amazing, very helpful and informative. They have a map at the front desk which they will go over in detail, recommending sites to see, places to eat and best times/routes to go. The rooms are neat, clean and definitely not the smallest we stayed in during our visit! Plenty of hot water and electrical outlets to meet your needs. Plenty of room for all of our clothes and 4 suitcases. Breakfast is stellar and more than enough to hold you over til lunch. Most everything is within walking distance and if it isn't, the metro is literally 2 minutes down the street. I highly recommend a night time walk to the colleseum from the hotel, it's an easy walk and the colleseo is beautifully lit. Plenty of great small restaurants within walking distance. Overall this was a wonderful experience and we intend to return to stay with them again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aishee S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Auditorium di Mecenate in January this year for five days, after reading great reviews on TA and they didn’t disappoint. We arrived in Rome tired and upset from Barcelona where we had been robbed and Auditorium changed all that. The rooms had no frills however were clean, all amenities were in place and worked. There was adequate heating, TV (although no English channels, but that’s not their fault), safe deposit locker, free wi-fi and the bathrooms were clean. The location is great- just a five minute walk from Termini- we walked to all the sites in Rome and none of them were un-walkable from this place- in fact walking in Rome is a beautiful experience! The Colloseo is a five minute walk. The rooms were cleaned meticulously everyday. In fact, we used to leave the room a bit untidy and would come back after a long day to find the room spotlessly clean, our beds made to perfection, our cupboards and even our desk arranged. It was like coming back home every night. Whatever this place lacks in the absence of frills they make up by treating their guests like royals. They gave us detailed directions as well as suggestions regarding the routes to follow for sightseeing, the best time to visit sites, best places to enjoy a good meals, et. all. They even kept our luggage for the night for no extra cost when we went to visit Venice. The owners/ staff were the best that we came across in our trip to Europe- friendly, courteous and very reassuring which we really needed after our previous bad experience in Barcelona. I would recommend this place for everyone for a great stay with no worries. Only flip side: the wi-fi was quite slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good for its price”
Reviews.Author: AlexandreGoulart
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good for its price. We paid 75 euros per night and got a cozy room, clean, but very small. The bathroom was also very small, hard to get a good shower. The services were good, employees very polite and breakfast in bed was ok. But would not recommend for families, couples, it is ok for single travelers, low budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, awesome staff, average room”
Reviews.Author: snowwhite01
Reviews.Content: 4 stars for the location and the staff, 3 stars for the room. Actually the room itself was ok (I was there 4 nights), it was the location of the room. The place was hard to find because there is no signage (it's on the third floor of an apartment building) however the staff were brilliant. They gave great advise on planning sight seeing and their dinner recommendations were also good although most of them required a 15 mins walk and having been on my feet for 9 hours, that was pushing it. Breakfast was basic but good and it was brought to the room each morning. I had the single room (number 5) which is right at reception so was very noisy with people buzzing the door to the building and everyone chatting at reception but I guess that's why I packed ear plugs. The room itself was clean and comfortable however I do wish these places would realise that travellers don't need cupboards, give us a few shelves, a couple of hooks for coats and somewhere to throw our back and we're happy. I was also woken up the smell of exceptionally strong coffee each morning, to point where I could taste it and was finding it difficult to breathe, not great for someone who can't stand coffee. All in all, I'd stay there again but just not in that room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: LarryC2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Auditorium Di Mecenate Rome in Jan 2012 and were glad that we made the right choice. The hotel is less than 15 min walk from Rome Termini train station and within walk distance to major visiting sites. The room is spacious by Italy standard, clean, and quiet. The staff was very helpful, nice and friendly (thanks a lot for making our stay pleasant). The breakfast was basic and brought to room by the staff each day. I would recommend to anyone who is looking for a comfy, affordable place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff but my room a bit rundown”
Reviews.Author: Dennis K
Reviews.Content: The staff were very nice and very help, and provided me with helpful tips for food/restaurants/sight seeing routes in Rome. The breakfast was quite decent. However, my room was a bit rundown. The window was like it's going to fall out when I tried to open it. The upper hinge was detached. The shower stall leaked. Obviously it has been a long term issue because the floor affected by the leak has old water stains and started to warp. The second night half way through my shower, the hot water ran out and I had to continue with cold water. I was told later that it can happen when everybody is taking shower. My room was the one just adjacent the kitchen. So don't pick that one, if you have a choice. I hope the management would pay a little attention to these small issues.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service and hotel was just as good!”
Reviews.Author: Suddaz
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 weeks traveling and this was one of our favorite hotels. From the moment we got there, Fabio (I think that was his name) was very helpful. He knew we were only staying in Rome for 2 nights and gave us great ideas on what to do in Rome, drawing us a plan on a map, which allowed us to really maximize our time there, with recommendations of when to see things, restaurants to eat at and shops nearby.  Fabio and the other staff were also very helpful and available at all times.  They were happy to give us wifi access and served an amazing breakfast when we required it.  The room itself was a really good size. It had a big bed, television and the bathroom was fine. It was also cleaned each morning.  The apartment was a short (maybe 1 km) walk from Termini station and it wasn't a problem transporting bags by foot.  *Just a note, when you get to the building where the hotel is, there is no clear sign protruding from the building. The address of the hotel corresponds to the street number on the building and the hotel itself is on the third floor. During the day, there is a doorman and he can direct you.  Don't be worried by the lift either - it seems like it has been there for 100 years but it's safe and saves you from carrying your bags up 3 flights of stairs! We used the hotel as a base and walked everywhere in Rome. It is a great way to see the city! If I was going back to Rome, I would have no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great hostess!!”
Reviews.Author: Pablo C
Reviews.Content: This was a really great hotel with a really great price. It's a 15 minute walk from the Collosseum and city center. The room was clean and comfortable, and breakfast was brought to our bed! But the best part of this hotel is the hostess. She was extremely friendly and always willing to help. As soon as we arrived she asked how long we were staying and then proceeded to suggest some tourism itineraries for our days. She helped us buy tickets for the Vatican on her computer, printed them for us, and put them in an envelope with a copy of our passports for us. She then gave us a list of recommended restaurants and pointed them out on the maps. This list of restaurants turned out to be GOLDEN. The suggested restaurants were not at all touristy, felt authentic, had AMAZING food and not expensive. The best pasta we've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Приятные впечатления”
Reviews.Author: Irina I
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, good location, the normal value for money

Reviews.Title: “My first week in Rome”
Reviews.Author: loobylindy
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel quite easily on foot from the railway station using directiond provided. Loved the ancient left to our floor. It was like the one which Cary Grant and Audrey Hepburn use in Charade. We'd booked the fresco ceiling room and were not dissapointed when we saw it. I love old italien buildings and this was true to form with the heavy window shutters like stepping back in time. Service was great in particular the efficiency with breakfast deliveries which we've never come accross before. You just phone when ready. The grapefruit juice was yummy. Bit dissapointed that all the croissant every day were all sweet and hence no hot ones although if we'd asked we prob would have got some. The position the hotel is in is brill for the metro plus tram and railway plus 10 mins from colloseum. Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. We didn't have alot of funds to spend eating out but there were a couple of supermarkets nearby where we purchased bread cheese etc to have a bed picnic each day. On the last night we had a pizza at a restaurant the staff use each day. Was lovely. Theres a fab icecream parlour just round the corner and up the road too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. The staff are lovely.”
Reviews.Author: amity1976
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel very welcome when we arrived. Kumar took time to show us a map of the city and how best to see the city. The room was compact but had everything you needed. Breakfast was good and was delivered to our room. We very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really satisfying for the price”
Reviews.Author: corbs315
Reviews.Content: I stayed by myself in June....worked out to about 75 USD per night for 3 nights. Breakfast, A/C, WiFi, and a private bath were my requirements, and they were exceeded. Bring ear plugs...the neighbors are rowdy :)

Reviews.Title: “ROME IS FANTASTIC!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kate_veli39
Reviews.Content: In early December i visited Rome with a friend of mine and we stayed at this hotel ιn the city center. The atmosphere is very warm and the environment very friendly. You feel like being at home!The location is very good point because it helps you to move around the city easily and quickly by metro. The hotel is very clean and the service is very good. The owner is this who makes you feel that you know each other from old days, he is very convenient and he is always there for you! I would really like to g o again and stay at the same hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service, fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Virginia G
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel really added to our experience of Rome. The room was lovely (we had a fresco room) and clean, the location was quite good as well. But what really made this a fantastic stay for us was the amazing customer service, and the breakfast in the morning - cappuccinos and pastries in bed is a fantastic way to start the day! Fabrizio is kind of like your cool Italian uncle throughout your stay, and his tips are absolutely golden. At the start of our stay, he gave us a run-down of how to get to all the sights, and a list of his favourite local restaurants (we especially loved Taverna Romana & Sora Margharita!). Then, he gives little tips each day - like a bakery with great pizza near where you're going. Anyway, his tips were always excellent and allowed us to experience traditional Roman cuisine in some great places. I hope to come back to Rome and stay at this great place again - couldn't recommend it more highly!

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Helen A
Reviews.Content: We have booked Auditorium di Mecenate from the good reviews of Trip Advisor> I could not find one negative review about this bed and breakfast and being there I was not disappointed. The rooms very clean and up to standard, but what makes this place special is the people running it. Mr Fabbrizio was very welcoming and very helpfull how to go around Rome, He gave us all the information we required and even his staff are very helpfull and they have an answer to all the question one can have, They are all very nice and gentle and they do their best to make their clients welcome. Well done Fabbrizio you have made our holiday a memorable one. Thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “A must in Rome”
Reviews.Author: wheressonya
Reviews.Content: When we think back about our trip to Rome, one of the highlights was staying here...... our room was lovely and clean and comfortable, the breakfast was delicious!! The location was perfect...but what really stood out for us was the service. 'Fabulous Fabrizio' and his wonderful staff (especially Giorgio) were the most friendliest and most helpful people we encountered in all of Rome. They gave us great tips of where to go and where not to go which was a refreshing change from looking through a stand of brochures. We will definitely stay here again next time we are in Rome. Highly highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Later is better than never”
Reviews.Author: gregorexs
Reviews.Content: This is my delayed review but I can not miss to say how cool this hotel is! Staff is very helpful and advised not only for the best places and shortest way to visit them but also for the best local restaurants where we enjoyed a real roman food. We liked the rooms pretty much - they are not luxuries but hey - you are in Rome: you just need to be positive and enjoy your stay. The breakfast in the rooms was nice, the room was worm (we stayed in February 2011) and clean with nice view to the street and still not noisy. Location is good as far as it is near to metro station. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Toby_Muc
Reviews.Content: you can feel when a place has got positive energy, and the auditorium is exactly such a place. They welcome you with warmth and true grateness that you are their guest. If you have any questions about the city, you canask everyone and will not leave with less than 5 suggestions where to go and what to do. Rooms are basic but very clean and everything you need (even a small fridge) and the little bathroom is very nice. You will not spend your time in the room anyway - rome has too much to offer. Special treat: Breakfast will be brought into your room. Bread, croissants, some more sweets, marmelade,...and a hot drink (I liked the hot chocolate which is made with milk!). Colosseum is just a 10min walk and another 5min to forum romano (do yourself a favor and visit both by night). I will definitely come back here the next time I'm in Rome. 5 Stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Even for my tiny little room, the service was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: 2manydogs
Reviews.Content: I took the cheapest possible single room and the first time I walked into it I was horrified at how tiny it seemed. After just a few minutes, though, I discovered how well planned it was and it became a safe, comfortable, and convenient home for five nights in Rome. I actually hesitated to use the word "service" in the title, because that is something that is bought and paid for. The relationship here is more like visiting family or friends who are too busy to go out with you, but want you to have a really great time in a city they consider the best in the world (even if they stick you in a tiny bedroom up under the eaves of the house). I suspect I had the worst room in the house. It was a tiny little thing right next to the entry desk. There was surprisingly little noise from people going down the hall to their more spacious quarters, although I could occasionally hear voices from animated conversions at the reception desk. Otherwise, the worst room in the hotel had a comfortable bed, good lighting, satellite tv, reliable wifi, AC, and plenty of hot water in the shower. The power saving electronics controls in the key card were impressive. And I was treated every bit as well as the people in the high end rooms. The neighborhood is safe and interesting--day and evening. After long days of sightseeing, I was never interested in nightlife so I can't comment on that. There are many places for a sit down meal or take out within a block of the hotel. I went to the grocery store just up the block and got salami, cheese, pesto, bruschetta, tomatoes, and apples for my lunches during the day and even some dinners. I bought the local wine and even got a wine glass at the 99 cent store. And then there is the gelato store almost next door . . . When you arrive, be sure to use the directions they send you in the confirmation email. It is a European hotel on one floor of a building with many other tenants. There is no big sign outside, just an address number and a reception desk or even just a buzzer after hours. My rating is based on the quality of the lodging in relationship to the price I paid. The furnishings and bedding are simple, but comfortable and efficient. The sincere pride and enthusiasm of the entire staff elevates this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tailstrike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auditorium di Mecanante for two nights and it was a great experience. Fabro gave us the full welcome briefing complete with list of his favorite restaurants. We had a room facing the street which was quite large. The street noise was noticeable but not obnoxious. The staff would serve us coffee in the room on request, and a great continental breakfast was also served in our room on request. Very nice stay, nice value.

Reviews.Title: “You Wont Find a Better Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover171
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was fantastic. The most outstanding thing was the customer service. I travel often, both for business and pleasure, and can't remember ever finding a hotel with better customer service! This was my first (and not my last) trip to Rome, and the people at this hotel made the difference. When arriving at reception the first time I was greeted by name, and although it was still before noon my room was ready. The room was a double (#24) at the back and it was always clean, quiet and in working order. We were provided more than a map of the city - we were shown the different areas to visit, places to eat and drink that locals use, the Metro stops closest to where we were going etc. We had the experience of being there during the "riot", and the staff showed concern for us and made sure we were always safe and steered away from dangerous areas. As the other reviews state, the hotel is close to the Metro, Termini, the Coloseum and Forum. The neighborhood was fine. The breakfast was fantastic, and as we had an early flight our last morning it was brought early, all you have to do is ask! We brought a bottle of wine to the room and asked for some glasses - we were provided with wine glasses and a corkscrew to open it with. The service is outstanding. We asked for a taxi to take us to the airport - all arranged. Wake up calls, no problem. Overall, it is a great small hotel in a large city with all the personal touches you could ask for - I will always stay here when in Rome, and recommend it to all my friends. Travel Hint: If going to the Vatican and wanting a private tour I can heartily recommend Federica D'Orazio, web site http://www.touristinrome.com. She met us at the hotel and was a perfect tour guide - worth it to beat all the lines!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and great location”
Reviews.Author: misskiki15
Reviews.Content: The place is a little hard to find but just make sure you read the directions in your reminder email properly before you get there unlike I did! The staff were WONDERFUL. I have never experienced such great customer service at a hotel before. They genuinely cared about their guests and always went out of their way for us and made great suggestions for sight seeing itineraries and places to eat. We felt very safe in the building and walking in the area. The hotel is close to a metro stop and walking distance to the Colosseum and other historical sites. Breakfast was good and the bathroom was small but clean and efficient. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 13ll
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the staff. They were the most helpful staff i have ever had in any accommodation and i've done a lot of travelling. They gave great advise on what to see and when the best times. They spoke english which was wonderful. They really seem to love their guest even offering me a coffee after a long days out and about! And i was unwell while in Rome and they even offered to go to the chemist for me as they knew i didn't speak italian. Now that is service! I am a solo traveller this time and felt very safe in the secure building. It's also hard to find nice and cheap accommodation and this was a great price. The room was always clean and not a bad size for a single. Breakfast was great and delivered right to your room. It was more than i could eat! The wifi was worked great and was free which a lot of places aren't. Great location, close to the termini station and the metro right around the corner. Also a good easy walk to the colosseum. Lots of little places to eat around there but an easy walk ir cab ride back to the hotel if you are a little further out. Would defiantly stay here again if i return to Rome adn recommend it to all my friends. Thanks so much to all the staff for the amazing help and service

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay - we shall return”
Reviews.Author: Bogdan S
Reviews.Content: A pleasant, affordable, clean, friendly place to stay in an exceptional location, where you receive free, tailored touristic information. We have just returned from Auditorium di Mecenate (we left yeaterday). Superbly located in less than two minutes walk from our room to the closest underground station (the one which connects you to the major Rome's attractions). Easy walk to Colloseum (15 minutes), as well as to other tourist attractions. Also, for families with kids, keep in mind that the closest supermarket (opened until late) in less 10 minutes walk, but also there are a couple of good convenience stores in less than 30 meters from the place. Comfy bed, humangous breakfast (wait until you see the real stuff, we thought they serve coffee in cups - but they were actually MUGS... so just imagine the size of the breakfast). Pretty strong coffee - I had to ask them to water it for me... The rooms are located in an historic building, with has a lovely interior garden - and they are very well maintained (clean and neat). There is a very good and free WiFi connection - they seem to be on a broadband. Also, I needed to print a couple of pages, and they helped us with this - at no charge, of course. The staff is absolutely gorgeous - starting with Mirela, Andreea, George, Kumar and of course, Fabrizio - thanks all of you guys for the great advice and taking care of us. They gave us, based on what we had on our agenda, customised hints on what would be the best things to do (and the best places to eat AUTHENTIC, delicious Italian food - the ones that locals eat, at local prices), and the best routes to take. Also, they helped us with bypassing long waiting lines from Vatican, Colloseum by making the arragements - either by phone, or by e-mail, so we really spent our time visiting, rather than waiting. These guys are non intrusive, friendly and helpful. And they speak a lot of languages - we've heard Romanian, English, Spanish, French and of course Italian (could be possible more as we saw guests from all continents). We were travelling to Rome, in order to meet our daughter's Godmother family from New Zealand: they were visiting Europe, and stayed in the same place with us (@ Auditorium di Mecenate). Initially we booked for a double room, and when Fabrizio and Mirela realised that our rooms were 10 meters apart, they managed to upgrade our room (at no extra charge - switching us from a double to a triple) in such a way that our rooms were close to each other, and therefore we felt even more that our families were really reunited. A big hug and a loud THANK YOU for the Auditorium di Mecenate team, for this heartwarming gesture :) This is the first place (after staying in many 5* hotels & resorts, in Europe, Africa, Middle East, Asia, Australia) in which I wish to return to - and the main reason for which I have started to write on tripadvisor, as I can not stand when injustice is made, especially to the good guys (IMO, fellows rating this place anything less than 5*, are either waaay too picky or just have very very limited travel exposure to places which are situated in the heart of historic cities like Rome). Keep up the good work guys!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably stay in Rome all because I stayed at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimimoura
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Italy, I wasn't very optimistic since I was already given the wrong directions to which bus I needed to take to get to Rome and I got lost looking for this hotel even though I had instructions on how to get there from the station. After climbing three flights of stairs, we (husband and I) were warmly greeted by the front desk staff. Their helpfulness made a huge impact on our trip. You can tell that they genuinely enjoy helping you get the most out of Rome. I arrived a lot later than I thought I would and missed my opportunity to see the Colosseum but I was given a very detailed map and was told to get off the subway at Flaminio station. I was assured I had plenty of time to see Rome in the day and a half I was there. I was a little skeptical, but when I walked out of the station, I was in awe. We were given two maps, one strictly for food since we both love to eat and the other was for attractions to see. We saw it all that evening, walking the whole way. The food recommendations was phenomenal. The hotel is comprised of 3 rooms. So you can expect to have some personal service as opposed to a large hotel. You do have to leave your card for security reasons. I requested to have a room with the ceiling painted, but I wasn't disappointed with my room at all. It had a large ceiling and everything I needed. The WIFI was a little finicky on my iphone. It took my husband a day to figure out how to connect properly. The breakfast was incredible. We called every morning and it arrived when I needed it. I took all the delicious pastries with me for snacks while we were exploring. My husband loved the coffee drinks. I can't recall what he ordered, since I am not a coffee person. The shower was smaller than what I am used to. I am 5'1, so I can imagine someone taller than me having issues maneuvering around. The room was always clean when we would return. I would stay here again just for the delicious breakfast and helpful staff if I were to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Wh0ami18
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay. The hotel was better than expected. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable. We especially enjoyed the breakfast in bed every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: ktm76
Reviews.Content: The staff were outstanding and very accomodating. On arrival we met the hotel manager who was full of Italian energy and provided us with a comprehensive suggestion of what to do during our short stay in Rome including transport and walking directions. He also gave us a few restaurant suggestions all of which are excellent, inexpensive and served authentic Italian food. The sort of place a local would go. The location was good. A short walk from the nearest metro and we could also walk to historical sights like the Colessuem. There was a supermarket in the street and many restaurants near by. The room was clean, comfortable and large for Rome. Free breakfast was served within 5 minutes of requesting it to our room each day which was a great way to start the day. I definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: pickinpr77
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. Fabbro was very helpful and received and treated us with su much hospitality that made us feel like home. The hotel is located close to Termini Station. The room was very nice and clean. The breakfast served to our room was fantastic. Fabbro arranged the taxi service to take us to the airport and the cost was very fair and reasonable. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Eddie and Claudia

Reviews.Title: “Best place EVER!”
Reviews.Author: jbarri
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were traveling in Europe this August and chose the Auditorium Di Mecenate based on other Tripadvisor reviews. I've never written a review before but this place was so absolutely incredible that I had to get on here and write one as soon as I got home. To start, the staff is just incredible. I've never experienced such wonderful customer service from any hotel or any other establishment. Marella greeted us upon our arrival and suggested the BEST restaurant which was just around the corner. So good we ate their twice. Not only did the staff help us with everything we needed, such as printing tickets to go to the Vatican to avoid lines but on our last day in Rome we intended on going to Florence but missed the bus. We emailed Fabrizio from the bus station and although the Auditorium di Mecenate was booked for the evening Fabrizio found us another place to stay for the same price. We were so grateful to have such wonderful help when we were stranded. The staff treated us more like family than like guests. Furthermore, the room was gorgeous! The fresca on the ceiling was just beautiful. You also can't beat that breakfast is delivered to your room and it's simply delicious! My favorite breakfasts of the trip were there; fresh made cappuccinos, orange juice, biscuits, various croissants...just really amazing. The location was excellent. Very easy to find from the train station and you are able to walk almost everywhere. Lots of delicious food right around the corner! Throughout the rest of our trip through Italy and France we kept comparing every place to the Auditorium di Mecenate and nothing held a candle. Really, the customer service made our trip in Rome a truly special experience. Not only can we not wait to return to Rome (absolutely beautiful) but we can't wait to get back to the Auditorium di Mecante! Thank you Fabrizio and Marella! You really made our time in Rome an incredible and memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Great Location, Quiet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: vanitysvial
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend Auditorium di Mecenate because the staff was charming and helpful. The hotel was a convenient location with rooms that could be made dark and quiet at night. First, the staff was excellent! After dropping off our bags, we gathered around the pad of maps at the front desk with Fabrizio and Antonella. There we shared a beer while Fabrizio marked up the city with sightseeing and dining suggestions for us. He gave us a "Top 11" list of restaurants, but throughout our stay he had other recommendations if our plans took us too far away from the main Fabrizio-approved list. The rest of the staff was helpful too. They all wanted to make sure we enjoyed our stay every day. We ran into a problem with our toilet the last two nights, and they explained the work-around to us (they had a hard time getting the plumber out) and got us a great deal on a taxi to the airport to apologize for our troubles. The room itself was nice although ours didn't have the painted ceiling shown in the pictures. I liked that the windows had shutters, so we could make it super quiet and dark at night. The shower was pretty tiny, but it was still usable. The hotel itself was weird to find (almost kitty-corner from the "Mas!" store with big wooden doors... it's listed on the small apartment directory: floor 3 but ground floor is zero). However, it was a short walk to Termini and only about a block away from Vittorio Emanuele. Overall, no complaints! Again, we really enjoyed our 6-night stay here. The friendly staff helped make our stay in Rome even better!

Reviews.Title: “What an experience.”
Reviews.Author: Scott1NZ
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling around for a month now with Rome being my final stop. I have had 3 nights here and at first it was a bit tricky to find although only took 15mins walk from termini and that was a slow way. The staff were very welcoming and helpful with directions to main attractions and great restraunts, which were great by the way. Breakfast is perfect and what you'd expect and the rooms are clean and had plenty of space, also Internet access is supplied. I was travelling solo and by far had the best experience here on my whole trip, be it with the room and staff both were better than much higher 'starred' hotels I have stayed in in the past. This is not my first time to Rome and certainly won't be my last, this also certainly wont be my last time staying here, perfect!.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Service”
Reviews.Author: Scarson
Reviews.Content: In September we stayed for 4 nights in the hotel. It is in a good location - a short walk to the Colosseum and very close to subway stations. As has been mentioned in other reviews, the breakfasts were excellent. The hotel is very good value indeed. The main thing that sets the hotel apart from others is the staff. Everybody, particularly Fabrizio, was extremely friendly and helpful. They gave us many suggestions about what to do and where to eat. The restaurants Fabrizio suggested were fantastic and very reasonable. After we had left the hotel we realised that we had left our fleeces behind. Fabrizio posted them home for us. Unfortunately one of the fleeces must have gotten lost in transit. When Fabrizio heard this he paid for the postage and packaging rather than charging us. This was totally unnecessary because it was not his fault but I think it shows how concerned the staff are about looking after their guests. Great value and great service.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marius R
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 nights here in August and all was perfect. it was a little bit difficult at the beginning to find the hotel but with the help of the owner with instructions by phone we found it easily. We arrived earlier and Fabrizio was very kind and let us check in earlier. He provided us a lot of information about what to do in 2 days and the order to do it. we started with the Colosseum found at aprox.15 min of walk, Roman Forum. We preffered to go early in the morning to avoid the crowds and the heat (around 6 am is the perfect time to go). We continued next morning with the Traiani forum and a big part of the day to Vatican (we bought the tickets online from Vatican site - less expensive and we were happy with this because we avoided a very long staying in line). After noon we continued with Piazza din Spania, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Fontana di Trevi. We choose to come the next early morning too at the Fontain to contemplate more this beautiful work of art . the breakfast was very good and enough to charge your batteries till the lunch (there is no restaurant in the hotel, there is only room service). the room and the bathroom were clean, the air conditioning was working properly. No negative points for this location we enjoyed a lot our staying here and we recommend this place to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Mom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last summer with my family, and promised Antonella I would write a glowing and much deserved review of our stay. We were a family of 5, including two young boys. We had two rooms, and we loved everything about this place. First, the staff was so helpful and friendly. My mom was with us, and she felt so at home, and my boys didn't want to leave after 5 days. There is an old world charm that is abundant here from the moment you open the large wooden doors to the building downstairs. The rooms were kept very clean, the breakfast in the mornings was good, and the coffees were the best!! When we left, I felt like we were saying goodbye to relatives--they all made sure my mom was comfortable and her coffee was made extra special in the mornings. Their suggestions for meals and places to visit were always spot on. When I return to Rome, I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else!! Thank you Antonella!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jcad343
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for a few days in July. The staff were tramendous. They greeted us with a bottle of Valpolicello. It was a great touch. They helped us learn about the city of Rome. They provided us with great ideas of tour plans for each day without having to pay for a tour group or guide. Fabrizio was a great help with special requests such a local restaurants to go rather than some of the tourist traps. The continental breakfast was very convinenient and efficient, fresh baked goods and the best cappucinno you could ask for. I would definately recommend to anyone coming to Rome and would stay here again. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Truly outstanding staff and terrific value”
Reviews.Author: Brenda W
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we could not have been made more welcome, even though we turned up pretty early in the morning - long before check-in time, and before the previous occupants of our room had even left. We were offered a room to freshen up, given a suggested itinerary, with consideration to the interests of everyone in our party, detailed travel directions - including temporary disruptions to the metro system - and were generally made to feel like we were the highlight of their day! The outstanding welcome and helpful friendliness even extended to the end of the next day, considerably after we had officially checked out. The rooms are simple - this is a budget hotel, not a Presidential suite at the Ritz - but really rather lovely, very comfortable, and the building itself is charming. We had highly decorated ceilings, period features, and polished stone floors in our rooms. The en-suite bathrooms and fittings are very modern and sleek, and the whole place sparkles with cleanliness. The location is excellent - ten minutes walk from the Colosseum, and less than that from Termini ( the main rail station). There's a metro station just around the corner, and the area felt safe. Make sure you know the street number of the hotel - the street entrance isn't immediately obvious, and is shared, so no big, glaring signage! Rooms at the front of the hotel can be a little noisy - but the one I had at the back was very quiet. Breakfast was both delicious and very generous - utterly fresh, melt-in-the-mouth croissants and pastries, juice, coffee, and really decent tea! If I ever return to Rome, I would rebook this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and customer service”
Reviews.Author: KC-Ottawa
Reviews.Content: I did not personally stay at the Auditorium; however, my daughter and her fiance stayed there during a tour of Europe in July-August 2011. The assistance provided by the hotel in advance and during their stay, a special note to Fabrizio, was amazing. The hotel was excellent location, clean, the breakfast great, and the tourist information was wonderful. In particular, I was most pleased that the hotel made every effort to make their stay so special. Based on the feedback from my daughter and her fiance, I can assured you that when I am in Rome next year, I will be staying at the Auditorium without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini and good stay”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaVentura_CA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about a 5-10 minute walking distance from the Termini Station but there is a closer station for traveling into the city. The hotel is located in a distinctly cultural district and located on the third floor of an apartment building (with a small lift). The hotel room was clean and decorated simply. Breakfast was a choice of drink and croissant delieverd in room at your choice of time. Kumar, the desk manager was incredibly kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: thefindlays2011
Reviews.Content: All of the wonderful reviews we read about the Auditorium di Mecenate were spot on. The hotel was perfect in so many ways. First, the staff are absolutely amazing. From our arrival to our departure, they were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast in bed was fantastic and the constant advice, from travel suggestions within the city to restaurant recommendations, always enhanced our experience. Second, the location of the hotel was excellent. A convenient Metro stop on the A Line (Vittorio Emmanuel) was three minutes away and the area was riddled with restaurants and cafes (as was most of Rome I guess). The Colosseum was a ten minute walk and the majestic Santa Maria Maggiore patriarchal church was just around the corner. Termini station, central to all train, Metro and bus transportation, is a simple ten minute walk. Finally, the room itself (a double room - two twin beds pushed together) was certainly adequate. We stayed for over a week and the room more than met our needs. There was storage for clothes, a good shower and the room was very clean. Our window looked onto an inner courtyard with the clothes of the adjoining apartment dwellers blowing in the breeze - certainly added to the local ambience. We would highly recommend the Auditorium di Mecenate. Thank you to the amazing staff for making our first experience in Rome such a memorable one...hopefull it won't be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Goood, clean hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: SashaSeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in good location ( about 10 minutes walk to Colosseum). My room was small but very clean and adequate with what looked like a newly renovated bathroom. A/C worked great and the staff was very nice. I had some trouble finding the place as it does not seem to have a sign outside ( unless I missed it) and when you get inside the building the hotel is on the third floor but I did not see anything to direct me there so I had to walk around each floor looking for the hotel. The only concern I has was that my room faced the exterior hall the building and there was quite a bit of noise at night from people walking and talking out there. My room was also right next to the front desk and that was a little noisy at night too. However; it did not keep me from sleeping and overall I was very pleased with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Iri-sha-tw
Reviews.Content: I lived in Auditorium di Mecenate with two doughters-teeneger in July 2011. It is small and very nice hotel in old building. It is in 10 minutes to stazione Termini, 5 minutes to Santa Maria Maggiore, 2 minutes to Metro “Vittorio Emmanuele”. Here are two supermarket (supermercato) – one, small, in 2 min, other bigger, in 5 min. There is old elevator, it always works and looks so amazing!! Of course we could go down by stairs, but prefer to use elevator :) Windows of our room were to the small yard, but who care about view from window if you are in Rome and come there to look this great city? So, we left hotel in the morning and came back only at night, and had there all what we really needed. Rooms are small, but you’ll have there all what you need – soft bed, clean towel, shower, frig, air conditioning (works silently and without additional cost), safe, TV (by the way, when we came, our TV in our room didnt work, and they changed it in some minutes - it is really shows how they are care about clients!!! New TV worked exellent!). Staff will bring to you breakfast any time when you want. It is really comfortable, especially if you have plans to leave hotel early morning, or if you want to sleep more. And I want to tell about very nice people, who work in this hotel. Mirela, Kumar, Giorgio (hope, his name is writing like this) – all of them are very friendly, and always ready to help you in any questions, to tell how is better to reach any place in Rome or near Rome, what is better to visit there. And special thanks to Fabrizio - for his excellent and helpful advice, patience and friendliness. He is as good guide, and knows a lot of about Rome and small town what is better to visit near Rome. Auditorium di Mecenate was my second hotel in Rome. And in next time I’ll book this hotel again and can recomment it. I absolutely love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: IrelandCleo
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel. Room basic but clean and comfortable . Continental breakfast excellent. Main plus was the owners / managers and staff. So friendly, helpful, and genuinely interested in your trip being enjoyable. Lots of great tips, Antonella in particular a wonderful host, but all were great. My second visit to Rome, hope to visit again nd because of staff, location, and breakfast would definitely return to this hotel. Only downside is that it could be noisy with the neigbours, but after so much sightseeing it didn't keep us awake for long. Travelled with my daughter and had a fantastic time, lots of thanks to all at Auditorium Di Menente.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: mullenelaine
Reviews.Content: You know all those old buildings in Rome that you wonder what they look like inside? Well, this is your chance. An absolutely charming hotel in an old apartment building, it is spotlessly clean, comfortable beds and high quality sheets and towels with air-con and free wi-fi all at a reasonable price. I absolutely loved it. The hotel is wonderful but the staff take it to a whole new level. They know the city inside out and will give advice on where to go with the time you have and tell you how to get around. Thanks again Fabbro for you kindness and for looking out for me. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you're on a budget and still want to be close to the action”
Reviews.Author: esp05
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for three nights last week and I feel happy with our choice. We wanted something within walking distance to the major sites, but still reasonably priced, safe and clean, and that is exactly what we got. Pros: *The people at the desk are extremely nice and helpful, especially the woman who works the morning shift ( I can't remember her name :( ) and Kumar, who works the late afternoon one. They were very friendly and willing to give advice about where to go. *The location is great, near enough to the Tremini station if you need to hop on the metro but far enough away so that the area isn't seedy. *Beds and pillows were comfortable enough *Breakfast is large and pretty good *It is clean *Very safe *Wifi, no extra charge *The old elevator is interesting. It looks like it might not get ya up there but it will. Drawbacks: *This place is hard as *&^% to find. Make sure you have the street name and the number because you'll need it. There is no hotel sign; it's in a building with other apartments. We walked past it a million times before figuring it out. *Our bathroom was "interesting"...shower door was hanging on by a thread and the walls were so thin that you could hear someone ruffle their clothing around in there. So yeah, it's not private; you'll get to know your traveling companion REAL well. *The walls are thin in general, so if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs. I did and that worked well for me. All in all I'd say go for it if you need to save money and still want something decent and conveniently located with nice people running it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: clowe11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. My husband and I were looking for just a clean place to stay that was close to the city. The hotel was right down the road from the Metro. The staff were very friendly. When we arrived there they greeted us by name and the man at the desk gave us really helpful tips. Also they give you a pretty good map. It was just a really nice place. It was clean and simple. Oh and my husband and I really needed to check our email and he allowed us to use his computer to print something out. It was just a wonderful place. I would def stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who is going to Rome. :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly helpful staff, great location, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mustin10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auditorium di Mecenate hotel for three nights and was very impressed. The hotel itself is well located being only feet away from the vittorio emmanuele metro station and a 15 minute walk from the colosseum. The staff are unbelievably friendly and helpful (someone on the reception 24hrs a day too) and will gladly give advice on any queries eg restaurants,travel options etc. The rooms are impeccably clean and the breakfast (brought to the room) is perfect to get you started for a day of roaming and sightseeing. I cannot recommend this place highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hospitality and staff”
Reviews.Author: WillTravelForStories
Reviews.Content: I read about the great service and helpful attitude of this charming guest house / B&B before booking. And all the positive reviews came true. I've never met such friendly, courteous and wonderful hotel staff. The manager told me that he only hired the right people and he was absolutely right. Also the room is cozy and clean with a modern bathroom, though it's on the small side and the hot water wasn't super warm or strong in the mornings, but that's expected in Europe. The continental breakfast was more than enough every morning. The 24-hour reception was convenient and the staff gave great tips on local restaurants and sightseeing routes. The location is ideal and safe. I hope someday to return to Rome and stay here again, as I made a wish at Trevi Fountain. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless rooms and fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tan010
Reviews.Content: Cannot rate this hotel highly enough...clean rooms, friendly helpful staff and a great breakfast! Make sure you have the correct address as it is a little difficult to find at first. It provided an excellent base for our stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel and a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Chanlion83
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Rome. The hotel is simple but very comfortable and clean! Breakfast in bed with huge Capuccino, Croissants, toast and orange juice. And there is free WiFi! The staff is absoultely helpful and nice. Thank you Antonella for your help! We had a great time and we would definitely come back to Auditorium di Mecenate!

Reviews.Title: “Wam, Cute, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Smrithi
Reviews.Content: This is the first time i booked a hotel online. Initially was not sure if the place would be what it was advertised like but i was extremely satisfied with the room, the people at the reception and especially the location of the hotel. The hotel is close to the Termini(10 mins walk). its located in a safe place on a busy road. the room was clean and cute to be precise. The people at the reception are extremely helpful in guiding you about traveling within Rome. it would strongly recommend this for people traveling with family or as couples.things i liked: 1. Clean Rooms 2. Warm Hospitality 3. Location 4. Guidance provided I would love to stay there again! I just stayed overnight so cant say about other facilties

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mbflips
Reviews.Content: Staff were fantastic. Everyone was incredibly helpful and friendly. Hotel is hard to find from the street, make sure you have the address as there is no sign. Room was a lot bigger than I thought it would be judging from the pictures on the website. Only negative was noise. Maybe it was just where our room was located but we could hear everything going on in the hallway and reception area.

Reviews.Title: “a great place”
Reviews.Author: klarcsika
Reviews.Content: its a really nice, clean place with excellent personal service. They are very friendly and helpful people. The location is perfect, very close to the city center and to the metro station. It was overall a very nice stay, a great value for money.I would definitely recommend it to anyone and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel - very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: szhang
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Roma Termini (which is where you get the bus, metro, inter city train) and a 1 min walk from the closest metro station. It is a little hard to find this hotel - there is no big sign outside since it is in one floor of a building. However, we called them and someone ran down straight away to come get us. The hotel itself is small - a few rooms and is family owned. Our room had very high ceilings and was clean and of a comfortable size. I think for the price that you pay it is very good value (we paid 100 euros per night). The staff are the highlight of this place though - they are very friendly and they suggested a nice itinerary for our stay as well as which trains/buses to catch everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Stazzione Centrale - a good valu option”
Reviews.Author: Tony S
Reviews.Content: A little hard to find it you haven't been to Rome before. We walked from the Station which took about 30 mins but only because we didn't know the best way - we could have taken the Metro to get closer but you soon learn these things. Australian artist AW (Tony) Scott put us onto this place - he made a call and got us the best room and it was really spacious and very comfortable. The hotel is on the 3rd floor and you have to negotiate 3 separate doors (each with a different key) and a pokey elevator (we had to go up one at a time with our bags when we arrived) and breakfast was very ordinary BUT in terms of value for money and proximity to the Metro it was pretty good. Tony Scott travels a lot so he usually has pretty good advice. We were happy with his suggestion, after all, Rome is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: msycip
Reviews.Content: All I expected was a place to spend nights, but the staff went above and beyond by recommending their favorite restaurants (and even calling them to see if they were open during the holidays) and helping to plan our entire itinerary. They know what to see and when to see it in order to beat the lines. The breakfast each morning was also a huge bonus. Get Fabrizio to draw on one of the maps for you and you'll be set to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “it made my trip”
Reviews.Author: Not_so_divine
Reviews.Content: a really nice, cosy and comfortable hotel, close to the center of Rome. It's really clean and there is everything you need in the room. Breakfasts are good and fast to get. The personnel members are the best guides ever starting with sightseeing and timing to best places to eat and have fun !! I would definitely recommend it to everybody! PS: and the prices are absolutely affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: mlimk
Reviews.Content: A nice cosy hotel located about 10-15 min away from the main station. Got a bit lost but asked around and eventually found the place - it is diagonally opposite a building with lots of flags (see attached picture) along Via Dello Statuto. The atmospere is friendly and warm with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Place To Rest for Quality Holidays”
Reviews.Author: LodiSingapore
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome 2 years ago, and stayed in Mr. Fabrizio's hotel (Hotel Lodi). Back then, I was deeply impressed by his service attitude and customer-centric approach. I did not remember promising him that I would be bringing my family with me in the future, as a proof of my satisfaction. Voila. My family was at their current new hotel in downtown Rome. Only then Mr. Fabrizio reminded me of my promise, with a loud laughter. I took it as a compliment. The hotel is extremely clean, quiet, efficient with even better service attitude from his new staff. His sister Toni was so warm that all bus lines and metro timings were hand written on the Rome map. With her help, we managed to navigate Rome without asking for direction. a single time. Mr. Fabrizio remained the same, attentive, warm and ready to liesten and help. We had a good drink to catch up our experience over the past twp years. I was even more impressed to see him wait for us on our return from Venice, at 9:00 pm before our return flight! This was just to bid us good bye and a safe trip home! Taken tiogether, I would highly recommend this hotel as a destination of choice for those who travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMochi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful from the moment I booked it on booking.com. I actually received a confirmation from the hotel manager before receiving the confirmation from the booking agency. I had booked a triple and so she wanted to know if I wanted a double bed or three single beds. I had inquired about transportation from FCO to the hotel and she provided me with several options including a taxi rate. After researching different prices, reading different forums, and a few emails to some of the TripAdvisor folks in Rome I found out that 50 euro was pretty good for 3 people from the airport. It was worth it because of our all our luggage. When we landed, our cab driver was waiting with a sign, drove us to the front of the hotel door and even helped take our luggage upstairs (hotel located on the 3rd floor). He was so nice! Antonella greeted us right away and allowed us to leave our bags in the reception area until our room was ready. She provided us with transportation information, a map of the city and circled attraction points for us. Here are some of the pros and cons. Pros: Cheapest hotel I found in Rome ($120/night for 3 people); very clean, quiet and spacious room and bathroom with high ceiling; super helpful staff; early check-in (we got our room at 11am); location was 5-10 min walk from the Vittorio Emanuele metro station and 15 min to the Colosseum and Palatine Hill; pharmacy, grocery store, pizzeria and cafe shops were located downstairs and around the corner; free wifi; I loved that breakfast was served in bed! Croissants were fabulous and fresh. Cons: The showering experience was bad for me because the water was either scorching hotel or freezing cold. On the 2nd day, I complained but my husband and brother looked at me with a "we don't know what you're talking about" look. Apparently it was perfect for them. The manager explained to me that I probably showered during "prime" showering time so that might have been why. They couldn't do anything about that. I suggest bringing your own towels. The hotel towels are very thin and are basically larger sizes of a typical dining napkin towel. Overall, our stay there was fabulous. The Italians there were not too welcoming and a bit ill-mannered but I was so glad that are trip started with us meeting so many nice and helpful ones. The cafe and pizza shop nearby was also filled with kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Red085
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in October. The place isn't far from the main train station and we walked it in about ten minutes. There is however a metro station even closer. Like some of the other reviewers we did find the hotel a little difficult to locate. Just remember to look for number 44! Once we had made it to reception we were greeted by Toni, who is possibly the most helpful person in Italy. She gave us lots of tips about where to go and the best ways of beating the queues. Ten minutes after arrival we had somewhere to leave our bags (though 2hrs early for check-in), a map and itinerary for the afternoon! The room was adequate for what we needed but its proximity to the main reception meant that it was a little noisy on occasion. We would definitely stay here again though we would ask for a different room. Many thanks to Toni and staff :0)

Reviews.Title: “For budget accommodation - this is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tronka66
Reviews.Content: We agree with all the positive comments made by previous reviewers. Clean, friendly - nothing is too much trouble. We were made to feel like part of the family. One recommendation though - check out exactly where the place is before you arrive. We'd looked up the address via Google Earth (you can just make out the street number (44) at street level), and checked out all the visual signs beforehand so we knew exactly where we were heading. Press the doorbell marked Auditorium di Mecante III if the door is locked. It's manned by a 'concierge' during the week up to about 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet refuge in a noisy city”
Reviews.Author: markoboston
Reviews.Content: We loved our room in this hotel. We had originally booked a stay at another hotel where we slept poorly because of the street noise. We moved to this hotel and found the rest we need. Besides comfortable, quiet rooms facing a courtyard, this hotel offers a lovely breakfast delivered to your room each morning. The owner, Antonella, offers excellent service and makes every effort to make sure that her guests are happy and comfortable. The neighborhood has a very central location, within a short walk of Termini Station, Rome's main train station. While the area right around the station can be a little sketch at night, we felt very safe on the west side of the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele, where this hotel is located. There is a Metro station at the Piazza, which provides quick access to most of the main sights of Rome. The Roman Forum and Colosseum are not on a Metro line, but they are an easy 20-minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jonquille604
Reviews.Content: One of our best accommodations in Italy. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Upon our arrival, Giorgio spent 15 minutes or so telling us about the best places to visit and dine. Since we'd already seen many of the major sites earlier on in our trip, he was able to suggest things a little bit off the beaten path, from a local's perspective. The room itself was beautiful, clean and super comfortable. Breakfast was a lavish affair of croissants and toast with coffee. It got a little noisy in the morning as we were fairly close to reception, but that seems to be the norm for accommodations in Italy. The service was impeccable and I could not recommend this place more.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic feel of Rome”
Reviews.Author: merle7598
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our favorite place we stayed in Italy. Location: Like the other reviewers say, the hotel is a bit hard to find (it would have been easier if we would have followed the directions on their website). It is located a few blocks from Termini station in the Asian district. Rite around the corner were several excellent restaurants, a small coffee bar next door, and a small market with all kinds of Italian delicacies (get the zucchini flowers, you won't be disappointed.) The historic district, Coliseum, Palatine Hill, Capitoline Museum, Roman Forum etc... can be reached by a long leisurely walk next to the Parco Di Triano. The metro is only a block away, allowing you to easily explore the rest of Rome. Room: The rooms were small by American standards, but very comfortable by European standards. They were clean, cozy, and air-conditioned. Service: Absolutely the best part of this hotel was the incredible staff. They were kind, patient, and always willing to help us on our journey. They recommended the best restaurants in Rome: Osteri Romana on Via Urbana (Also known as Osteria della Suburra‎), La Famiglia, 313 Cavour (wine bar), and others. They were very knowledgeable on shopping, sightseeing, local markets, and even helped us to learn to live the Italian way (which is the best part of being in Italy). Breakfast: Breakfast consisted of the typical Italian hotel continental breakfast of glazed croissants with several condiments, toasted bread, choice of coffee, and juice all served in bed.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel that give you home feeling”
Reviews.Author: zhangjing9456
Reviews.Content: I arrive in hotel before check-in time, however,the room is ready and Antonella let me check-in and have a break, then Giorgio show me the map and mark where the best place is. Since I book single room, it is small but nice and clean. I love it. It is quite near to metro station Vittorio Emanuele. Pay attention, it is small hotel and in 3rd floor, if you can not find it,please ask somebody help you, all people in Roma is very kind and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: magmapi
Reviews.Content: We were more than comfortable at this small 3d floor hotel. The room was clean, modern, quiet and located in an excellent area of town near a few wonderful restaurants and inexpensive shopping. We were served a nice breakfast in our room every morning and we were made to feel at home. The management (Toni in particular) went out of their way to accommodate us and were most helpful in providing information about the city. The place was a bit hard to find because there is no obvious sign on the street but it is in the building #44. You need to be buzzed in and take an old elevator to the 3d floor. Watch out - the doorman/elevator guy is a little grouchy but other than that we loved our little place. The area is not great but its in sort of a transitional area between the train station and nicer communities. We can highly recommend this hotel in Rome. This is where we will stay again when we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Celine0310
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the hotel and found every minute of our stay fantastic. The room was extremely clean, everything was working well. We also appreciated having a nice breakfast in the room in the morning and being so warmly welcomed by everyone (especially by the very nice receptionist at night). The air conditioning is a big bonus considering the temperatures in Rome at this time of the year! The lovely lady owner gave us great advice on what to do and how to make the best of our time and money. It is very well located and there is easy access to metro and buses. That's a 100% satisfaction! And I'll definitely go back again the next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and good value for a memorable trip to the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: mscatter
Reviews.Content: My friends and I traveled to Rome for our friend's birthday and thanks to Antonella and her great staff we not only felt welcomed but cared for on our arrival and throughout our stay in Rome. Before our arrival Antonella sent an e-mail confirmation to double check our needs as far as accommodation and she gave us excellent directions and great advice on how to get to the hotel and how to save a bit of money with a metro pass (good for the whole week) rather than individual trip tickets!! Since we were staying for 5 nights Antonella suggested we take it easy our first day and gave us a great walking tour to take, which highlighted many of Rome's most notable and famous sights!! Antonella also arranged for an additional tour with a local company to Naples and Pompeii, which was amazing as well, and it was a relief having a native Italian speaker making all of the arrangements! She also gave us great advice about staying safe in a foreign city! For my friend’s birthday Antonella had a lovely flower arrangement waiting in our room when we got back from our tour of Naples and Pompeii! The hotel is conveniently located to the metro and not too bad of a walk to the Colosseum and other tourist attractions. Our room had a lovely, decorative, painted ceiling with three beds and a private bathroom. Breakfast was brought to our room every morning with juice, toast, croissants, and a hot beverage! Overall the room was what was expected for the price range in Rome, but the service was exceptional! I will definitely be returning to Auditorium di Mecenate in future visits to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm... It is so hard to find. We finally...”
Reviews.Author: Hammy_Teare
Reviews.Content: Hmmm... It is so hard to find. We finally found it, but let me say their directions are not helpful. Look for a big wood door and the hotel name is one of the apt. buzzers. It is not clearly marked so be ready to be a bit frustrated. The room was basic and looked at a cement wall. Had all our basic needs but definately nothing extra. We were not informed of the breakfast at check on so we missed on day 1 and the would not serve early when we had to catch the train on our last day. The location was not great. The neighborhood wasn't bad, but it was not good either. I would look for somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: dspurdy
Reviews.Content: I traveled with two friends to Rome at the end of May and we stayed in this hotel for 5 nights.
